column4: Hi All! I have a problem turning off my PC. Seem the apm turn off doesn't work. HDD goes to sleep but the power does not go off. The problem is only on ubuntu. I've tried to boot with various options (apci=off and so on). It doesn't help. Please help it's really frustrating...
what do you use to turn it off?
several… poweroff, kde "turn off"...
did you try through  the GUI
yes. and also sudo poweroff over ssh.
are you using Kubuntu?
yes.
oooo, I had a very bad experience with  it, I don't mean to make your situation worse.
you mean kubuntu?
yes, if you can, stay away from it
are there alternatives with KDE?
BTW: mint 12 have the same issue.
I use Ubuntu, Fedora and BT, the rest are on my vmware for testing, mint was ok, are you looking for a lightweight version?
I'm looking for a stable version with KDE.
this is for my girlfriend. I use gentoo myself.
give "Lubuntu" a try, but that's LXDE. why not ubuntu? unless you have very old hardware.
I tried Sabayon. It runs very good on this PC and turns off the power after shutdown but it's gentoo like. This means update -> recompile things...
ubuntu uses Gnome and who worked with kde is a lot different….
if you don't mind switching to "yum/rpm", try Fedora KDE.
that would be an alternative. Though it is not always up to date or is it my wrong information...
I have no idea, I don't really like Debian
